sentences.text: The Company maintains the Senior Officer Change in Control Severance Plan (the CIC Severance Plan), which the Board has the ability to amend or terminate with at least one years notice to participants.

sentences.text: The Board considers the maintenance of an effective and stable management team essential to protecting and enhancing the value of the Company for the benefit of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, we recognize that the possibility of a change in control may exist and that this possibility, and the uncertainty and questions it may raise for certain senior executives, may result in the distraction, and potential departure, of senior management employees to the detriment of the Company and our stockholders.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Company policy and procedures governing lobbying, both direct and indirect, and grassroots lobbying communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Payments by MSI used for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) direct or indirect lobbying or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. MSIs membership in and payments to any tax-exempt organization that writes and endorses model legislation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Description of managements and Boards decision making process and oversight for making payments described in sections 2 and 3 above.

sentences.text: For purposes of this proposal, a grassroots lobbying communication is communication directed to the general public that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) refers to specific legislation or regulation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) reflects a view on the legislation or regulation and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) encourages the recipient of the communication to take action with respect to legislation or regulation.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stockholders, we encourage transparency and accountability in use of corporate funds to influence legislation and regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MSI spent $3.38 million in 2014 and 2015 on federal lobbying (opensecrets.org).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These figures do not include lobbying expenditures to influence legislation in states, where MSI also lobbies but disclosure is uneven or absent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, MSI had 160 lobbyists in 26 states in 2015 (http://www.followthemoney.org/), and MSIs lobbying in Florida has attracted media attention (Special Interests Flood Florida Legislative Campaigns with $28 Million in 6 months, Miami Herald, January 17, 2016).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has considered the above proposal and believes that full implementation is not in the best interests of the Company or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company already discloses information about its lobbying, as required by existing law and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2015, the Company added disclosure to its website as part of its Corporate Responsibility Report describing its policies relating to lobbying activity as noted below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is subject to extensive regulation at the federal, state and local levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company engages with public policymakers at all levels of government when it believes doing so will serve the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is committed to participating in the political process as a good corporate citizen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the Company has developed effective policies for the appropriate disclosure and oversight of its lobbying activities and is fully committed to complying with all laws governing lobbying activities, including laws requiring registration and reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company requires any employee who engages in lobbying in support of the Companys objectives to first obtain written approval from the Government Affairs organization (GA), who reviews the scope of proposed lobbying activities, justification and applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any employee who retains an independent contractor as a lobbyist must consult with GA to identify a suitable contractor and obtain prior written approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subcontracting by lobbyists is also subject to pre-approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments to lobbyists must be commensurate with the value of the services provided by the lobbyist to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All lobbyists must enter into a signed consultant services agreement using a pre-approved form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special lobbying rules may apply when the Company is seeking to do business with a government.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GA conducts training on applicable laws and the Companys lobbying policies and processes for independent contractors and employees who engage in lobbying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GA is also responsible for ensuring that individual lobbyists acting on behalf of the Company file all of their required reports, registrations, filings and disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995, as amended, the Company submits quarterly reports to Congress which outline the Companys federal lobbying activities, including lobbying expenditures for the quarter and the specific legislative items that were he topics of communications, and identifying the individuals who lobbied on behalf of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These reports are available at: http://lobbyingdisclosure.house.gov/ and http://www.senate.gov/legislative/Public_Disclosure/LDA_reports.htm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company iles similar periodic reports with state agencies reflecting state lobbying activities which are also publicly available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like most major corporations, the Company is a member of trade associations that represent its business priorities and that it believes can assist it in achieving its long-term strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary purpose of membership in these trade associations is the policy, technical, and industry expertise these organizations provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company periodically reviews its memberships in these associations, which may sometimes take positions on legislation or communicate with government officials on public policy issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although lobbying is not the primary purpose of many of these associations, the membership dues paid by the Company and other members may be part of the funds they use to engage in lobbying activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, given the diverse membership in many of these associations, the Company may not agree with every public policy position and/or lobbying action taken by such associations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company already discloses, as part of its Corporate Responsibility Report (http://responsibility.motorolasolutions.com/) the names of associations in the U.S. where annual dues are $50,000 or more.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that additional disclosure would not necessarily present an accurate reflection of the Companys positions on certain public policy issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is involved in a number of legislative initiatives that could affect its business and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The additional disclosures of proprietary and confidential information required by this proposal could place the Company at a competitive disadvantage by revealing its corporate strategies and priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because parties with adverse interests also lobby for their own business reasons, any unilaterally expanded disclosure by the Company regarding its lobbying activities could benefit these parties to the detriment of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By requiring expanded disclosure of lobbying activity, this proposal disregards the Companys existing policies and practices with regard to disclosure and compliance with the law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the Company has robust policies and procedures in place relating to its lobbying activities, and therefore, this proposal is unnecessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the Board believes this proposal is not in the best long-term interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board recommends that you vote AGAINST this proposal.

sentences.text: The Company has been advised that Domini Social Equity Fund, beneficial owner of 201 shares, intends to submit the following proposal for consideration at the Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: WHEREAS, the 2016 Global Slavery Index estimates that 45.8 million people are in some form of modern slavery in 167 countries (http://www.globalslaveryindex.org/findings/).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, companies have the corporate responsibility to respect human rights within their operations and supply chains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a multinational company dependent upon extended supply chains in many countries, Motorola Solutions must assess if workers are being recruited into debt bondage, forced labor and, ultimately, slavery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is growing awareness of the role of unscrupulous labor recruiters in exploiting workers and job seekers through charging fees, withholding personal papers/passports and failing to provide written contracts spelling out the terms of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to put proactive policies and procedures in place exposes a company to significant risks, including legal action and media reports that negatively impact reputation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The electronics industry has come under increased scrutiny for labor abuses in factories including the exploitation of migrant workers who have paid fees to obtain employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to a US Department of Labor-funded study, 92 percent of the migrant workers in Malaysias electronics industry had paid recruitment fees and that 92% of that group had paid fees that exceeded legal or industry standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Report Cites Forced Labor in Malaysias Electronics Industry, New York Times, September 17, 2014)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its June 2016 ICT Benchmark Findings Report, KnowTheChain found that only four of 20 publicly traded companies reviewed demonstrated awareness of the risks when recruitment agencies are used to hire workers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this finding, unethical recruitment of migrant labor is a serious risk for the entire sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motorola Solutions was not included in the report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The State of California and the United Kingdom have passed laws requiring companies to report on what they are doing to eradicate human trafficking and slavery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. federal contractors are currently required to put in place compliance programs for their extended supply chains to assess and address any abuses associated with charging workers recruitment fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motorola Solutions is a government contractor, has ethical recruitment policies, and describes its process for implementing its forced labor and human trafficking policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, out of its entire global supply chain, Motorola Solutions only audited fourteen sites in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reports that 21 freely chosen employment issues were identified, but provides no further information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investors have insufficient information to gauge how well the company is addressing this serious risk to workers and to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, Shareholders request that by December, 2017 the Company begin publishing, at reasonable cost and excluding proprietary information, an annual report disclosing specific remedial efforts taken to ensure that its global supply chain is free of forced or bonded labor, including any efforts to reimburse workers for recruitment fees that we paid in violation of the Companys policies.

sentences.text: Our Human Rights Policy was amended effective December 1, 2013 and is posted to our website.
